'''Silmesse''' is a song in the [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]-related album ''[[In Elven Lands]]'' by [[The Fellowship (band)|The Fellowship]]. The title means "In the Moonlight" and the lyrics were written by [[Helge Kåre Fauskanger]] in [[Neo-Elvish|Neo-Quenya]].
==Elvish lyrics==
<poem style="font-style:italic; margin-left:20px;">Sinome háran i marya silmesse; 
Ilmello sílar tinwi lómesse; 
Cénanten, i telpeva hendi, 
ve cennente i cuivie Quendi. 
Alasse antar i menelmíri, 
laitan mi anvanye líri. 
Oiale ná i silme vinya; 
tíranyes sí vi Quende minya, 
vi minya Cuiviéneno
cenne cala eleno.</poem>

==English translation==
<poem style="font-style:italic; margin-left:20px;">Here I am sitting in the pale moonlight; 
from Ilmen sparks are shining in the night; 
They see me, the silvery eyes, 
as they saw the wakening Elves. 
Joy the heavenly jewels give me, 
I praise them in the fairest songs. 
Forever is the moonlight new; 
I watch them now as the first Elf did
as the first one of Cuiviénen 
who saw the light of a star.</poem>
